title: 508 Checker
creator: Formstack
description: With 508checker.com you can quickly check a webpage for 508 compliance and learn more about how to become 508 compliant across your entire organization
guideline: Section 508, <abbr title="United States">US</abbr> federal procurement standard

title: Accessibility color wheel
creator: Giacomo Mazzocato
description: A tool that helps in the choice of a color pair (text/background) to use in a web page. It simulates three kinds of color blindness and it shows the result of w3c algorithms that reveal if the colors are accessible
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0

title: Accessibility Developer Tools
creator: Google Accessibility
description:
Adds an Accessibility audit, and an Accessibility sidebar pane in the Elements tab, to your Chrome Developer Tools.

- 17 audit rules; most documented at http://goo.gl/L7gCXu
- Sidebar pane in Elements tab provides extra debugging information, for example color contrast values and color suggestions, missing required ARIA attributes, reason for lack of visibility, accessible name calculation information, etc.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0

title: Accessibility Management Platform (AMP)
creator: SSB BART Group
description: The Accessibility Management Platform (AMP) is a web-based platform that provides a scalable, turnkey solution for meeting your Section 508, Americans with Disabilities (ADA) and Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) compliance needs through comprehensive testing, reporting and training.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0
Section 508, <abbr title="United States">US</abbr> federal procurement standard
<abbr title="Japanese Industry Standard">JIS</abbr>, Japanese industry standard
Irish National IT Accessibility Guidelines
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: AccessIn
creator: Digital Accessibility Centre
description:
Real time accessibility maintenance and reporting tool
Captures issues within the DOM and allows evaluation experts to assess and feedback to client, replicating Operating System, browser and device.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: AccessMonitor
creator: Fundação para a Ciência e a Tecnologia, IP
description: It’s being used by the Portuguese Public Administration. Anyone can get a free report of a Web page. The public agencies can create a sample of pages of a website to monitor - they also can monitor the new pages entered. The system have a dynamic logo that summarizes the results based on the sample.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: Color Oracle
creator: Bernhard Jenny
description: Color Oracle is a free color blindness simulator for Window, Mac and Linux. It takes the guesswork out of designing for color blindness by showing in real time what people with common color vision impairments will see.

title: Contrast checker
creator: Contrast checker
description: Checks for compliance with the contrast levels, brightness and shine in the color combination of foreground and background of textual content based on the requirements of WCAG 1 and WCAG 2.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0

title: Contrast-Finder
creator: Tanaguru
description: Provides solutions for contrasts. For a given couple of color (bakcground/foreground), Contrast-Finder evaluates the contrast ratio and if it not good, provides valid colors, closed to the initial ones.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr lang="fr" title="Référentiel Général d’Accessibilité pour les Administrations">RGAA</abbr>, French government standard
automated: any part color of the page thanks to the color picker

title: examinator
creator: Carlos Benavidez
description: An on-line automatic evaluation tool that tests techniques and failures from WCAG 2.0 using a metric to reflect results in a quantitative way.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0

title: HeadingsMap
creator: HeadingsMap
description: It generates a documentmap with headings and/or with sections in HTML 5. It shows the headings structure, the errors in the structure (ie. incorrect levels), and it works as HTML5 Outliner too.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0

title: HTML Validator for Firefox
creator: Marc Gueury
description: HTML Validator is a Mozilla extension that adds HTML validation inside Firefox and Mozilla. The number of errors of a HTML page is seen on the form of an icon in the status bar when browsing. The details of the errors are seen when looking the HTML source of the page.
guideline: <abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: HTML_CodeSniffer
creator: Squiz
description: Checks a HTML document and detects violations of a defined coding standard. Comes with standards that cover the three conformance levels of WCAG 2.0 and the U.S. Section 508 legislation. An auditor interface is provided by a bookmarklet to let you try out these accessibility checks on any web page.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
Section 508, <abbr title="United States">US</abbr> federal procurement standard

title: Opquast desktop
creator: Opquast
description: Firefox plugin to test more than 450 tests on quality, seo, accessibility, performance. You can also add comment when you found bugs and export your result in a cvs file or to your projets in opquast.reporting.com
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr lang="fr" title="Référentiel Général d’Accessibilité pour les Administrations">RGAA</abbr>, French government standard

title: Opquast Reporting
creator: Opquast
description: Opquast Reporting is website quality and accessibility assessment tool. It include features to evaluate manually and automatically, to export audit report in various format, to create tasks from bugs found during the evaluation
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr lang="fr" title="Référentiel Général d’Accessibilité pour les Administrations">RGAA</abbr>, French government standard
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: PEAT - Photosensitive Epilepsy Analysis Tool
creator: Trace R & D Center, University of Wisconsin-Madison
description: The Trace Center's Photosensitive Epilepsy Analysis Tool (PEAT) is a free, downloadable resource for developers to identify seizure risks in their web content and software. The evaluation used by PEAT is based on an analysis engine developed specifically for web and computer applications.

title: Reading Effectiveness Tool
creator: Clear Language and Design (CLAD)
description: The tool helps to to find out if a draft manuscript is at the right Grade Reading Level for the intended audience, by asking a series of questions. It is based on the Simple Measure Of Gobbledegook (SMOG) readability formula.

title: Tanaguru
creator: Tanaguru
description: Tanaguru is an opensource (AGPL license) website assessment tool. It is dedicated to accessibility (a11y) audits, and focuses on reliability and high level of automation.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr lang="fr" title="Référentiel Général d’Accessibilité pour les Administrations">RGAA</abbr>, French government standard
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites
user defined scenarios over multiple pages / forms

title: Tenon
creator: Tenon
description: Tenon is a one of a kind accessibility testing tool in that it is aimed at offering unprecedented flexibility in tooling for designers developers testers and content authors. Tenon achieves these goals via its API which can be seamlessly integrated into your existing toolset.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0
Section 508, <abbr title="United States">US</abbr> federal procurement standard
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: Total Validator
creator: Total Validator
description: Total Validator is a 5-in-1 validation tool, comprising of an (X)HTML validator, an Accessibility validator (WCAG and US508), a CSS validator, a spell checker, and a broken links checker. It can be run from the desktop, the command line, or via Chrome and Firefox addons.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0
Section 508, <abbr title="United States">US</abbr> federal procurement standard
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites

title: UCDmanager
creator: jordisan
description:
UCDmanager is a FREE collaborative web application aimed to manage and document different User-Centered Design and usability techniques, in an integrated manner: user roles, personas, heuristic evaluations, usability user testing, etc.

Includes accessibility evaluations and heuristics: http://ucdmanager.net/technique/web-accessibility-conformance-evaluation

Windows 8 app: http://ucdmanager.net/app
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
<abbr title="Web Content Accessibility Guidelines">WCAG</abbr> — <abbr title="World Wide Web Consortium">W3C</abbr> Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0

title: Vamolà
creator: Regione Emilia-Romagna
description:
This is a ready installed version of aChecker validator (online accessibility checker) plus:
- new Guideline called "Allegato A L. 4/04" (relative to Italian laws aka Stanca ACT)
- full Italian language translation. 

The project is open-source and on-line at https://github.com/RegioneER/vamola
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
Stanca Act, Italian accessibility legislation

title: Visolve
creator: Ryobi System Solutions
description:
Visolve is the software tool that transforms colors of the computer display into the discriminable colors for various people including people with color vision deficiency, commonly called color blindness.
The web version and iOS version have the simulation feature that can simulate the appearance of an image for people with color blindness. By using this feature, people with normal color vision can check how color-blind people see a scene or a signage, etc.
assists: Modifying the presentation of Web pages

title: WCAG Compliance Auditor
creator: Funnelback
description: WCAG Compliance Auditor checks entire websites, and even groups of websites, against WCAG criteria. It identifies failures, provides recommendations on how to fix errors and delivers a benchmark against which accessibility can be measured over time, helping organisations to achieve compliance.
guideline: WCAG 2.0 — W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0
automated: Groups of Web pages or Web sites
